abstract: Rev Warren Hall, who was fired as director of Seton Hall University campus ministry, places himself in center of Roman Catholic Church's internal debate around gay faithful by revealing to Outsports.com that he is gay; archdiocese says Hall's sexuality had nothing to do with his firing, but Hall has been relatively outspoken on issues of sexuality and identity.
lead_paragraph: After being fired as director of the campus ministry, the Rev. Warren Hall revealed in an interview that he was gay, putting him at the center of a debate roiling the Catholic Church.

headline.main: Firing of Seton Hall Priest Highlights a Catholic Debate on Gay Believers
headline.print_headline: Ouster of Priest at Seton Hall Points to Soul-Searching About Gay Catholics

snippet: After being fired as director of the campus ministry, the Rev. Warren Hall revealed in an interview that he was gay, putting him at the center of a debate roiling the Catholic Church.
